lead_paragraph: Four men who had been cheated by a contractor each received checks of about $50,000 from New York City after a cabdriver recognized one of them.

headline.print_headline: Cab Ride Nets $200,000 for a Construction Worker and His Friends
headline.main: Cab Ride Nets $200,000 for a Construction Worker and His Friends

snippet: Four men who had been cheated by a contractor each received checks of about $50,000 from New York City after a cabdriver recognized one of them.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column describes lengthy search by New York City comptroller's office for former construction workers cheated out of prevailing wages by companies overseeing construction projects; office has had difficulty finding locating some of the workers for whom they have been holding recovered wages because so many are undocumented immigrants.
